subject: Creativity
title: Slapstick: The Ancient Art of Falling Down Funny
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Slapstick: The Ancient Art of Falling Down Funny.

hook.text: Someone slips on a banana peel. You laugh. You know you shouldn't.

buildup.text: Slapstick gets its name from the 'batacchio' â€” a paddle that made a loud slap sound in commedia dell'arte.

discovery.text: Slapstick triggers superiority theory: we laugh because we're relieved it's happening to someone else.

twist.text: Great slapstick requires extraordinary athleticism. Buster Keaton, Jackie Chan, and Lucille Ball were all elite.

climax.text: Jackie Chan's blooper reels show the price of physical comedy â€” broken bones, concussions, near-death falls.

punchline.text: Falling down is easy. Falling down funny takes a lifetime of practice.

quiz.question: Where does the word 'slapstick' come from?
options: A paddle (batacchio) used in commedia dell'arte
